module_metadata.title: Multi-App Solution Workflows
module_metadata.purpose: Pre-built Zoho workflows solving common business scenarios

workflows.business_scenario: B2B company wants to automate entire sales process from website visitor to paid invoice
workflows.problem_statement: Leads come from website, need follow-up, quotations, deal closure, invoicing, and payment tracking - all disconnected currently
workflows.current_pain: Leads lost between marketing and sales, quotations in Word/Excel, invoices manual, no payment tracking, multiple data entries, zero visibility

workflow_steps.action: Visitor fills contact form on website
workflow_steps.what_happens: Form data captured with UTM source tracking
Form submission triggers automatic lead creation with source tag
Zia AI scores lead based on profile, auto-assigned to sales rep by territory/product
If not hot lead, enters 5-email drip campaign over 2 weeks
Tasks created automatically, call logging, email tracking
Quote template filled with CRM data, PDF generated, sent with tracking
Automatic notifications to manager, forecast updated
Contract generated from template, sent for signature, tracked in CRM
Auto status update to 'Closed-Won', notifications sent
CRM deal data flows to Books, invoice created with correct line items
Professional invoice emailed, customer portal access provided
Reminders at 7, 3, 1 days before due date, then after
Bank feed auto-matches payment, invoice marked paid, CRM updated

before_vs_after.data_entry_time: 30 min per deal → 2 minutes (initial form only)

roi_calculation.scenario: B2B company, 200 leads/month, $5,000 average deal value

discovery_questions_to_qualify: How many leads do you generate per month?
What happens after a lead comes in?
How long from lead to closed deal currently?
Where do leads fall through the cracks?
How long does contract signing take?
Do you know your exact conversion rate?
How do you track outstanding invoices?

objection_responses.too_complex: Seems complex when I explain all 13 steps, but that's the point - it's automated. You do step 1 (form fill), system does steps 2-4 automatically. You do steps 5-6, system automates rest. Actually saves huge time.
objection_responses.too_expensive: Five apps sound expensive? Let's calculate. You're generating X leads, converting Y%. If we increase conversion even 3% (very conservative), that's Z additional deals. What's Z deals worth to you? More than $150/month?
objection_responses.we_dont_need_all_apps: Fair. Which parts of the workflow are working perfectly for you now? [Let them identify gaps] Usually marketing-sales handoff is broken, OR quoting takes too long, OR payment collection is slow. We can start with just fixing your worst pain point.

workflows.upsell_opportunity: Start with CRM + Forms (lead capture). Once adopted, add Campaigns (nurturing), then Books (invoicing automation), then Sign (faster contracts). Phased approach reduces change management.

workflows.business_scenario: Online store wants to automate from order placement to delivery tracking with inventory sync
workflows.problem_statement: Orders from website, manual inventory update, manual invoicing, shipping coordination chaos, customer asking 'where's my order'
workflows.current_pain: Order comes → manual inventory check → manual invoice → manually arrange shipping → customer calls asking status → email shipping info manually

workflow_steps.what_happens: Order captured with payment gateway integration
Stock reduced automatically, if low stock → alert triggered
Invoice created from order data, emailed to customer
Warehouse receives packing slip with order details
Integration with shipping carrier (FedEx, etc.) generates label
Tracking number emailed to customer automatically
Customer portal shows real-time tracking
Support queries automatically linked to order history
Automatic purchase order created when stock hits reorder point

investment.training_time: 1 day for warehouse, 1 day for support

roi_calculation.scenario: E-commerce store, 500 orders/month, $80 average order value
roi_calculation.customer_satisfaction: Fewer support tickets, better reviews → 5% more repeat customers = +25 orders/month × $80 = $2,000

perfect_for: E-commerce stores (Shopify, WooCommerce, or Zoho Commerce)
discovery_questions_to_qualify: How many orders do you process per month?
How do you currently manage inventory?
How much time spent on order processing?
How often do you face stock-outs?
How do customers track their orders?
How many 'where's my order?' inquiries daily?
Do you sell on multiple platforms?

workflows.workflow_name: Customer Support to Product Improvement Loop
workflows.business_scenario: SaaS/product company wants to close the loop: support tickets → identify product issues → create improvement tasks → track implementation → notify customers
workflows.problem_statement: Support team receiving same issues repeatedly, product team unaware of customer pain, no connection between tickets and product roadmap, customers feel unheard
workflows.current_pain: Support tickets pile up → product issues buried in ticket system → product team working on guesses → customers frustrated seeing no improvements

workflow_steps.what_happens: Ticket created, categorized (bug/feature/improvement)
Dashboard shows most common issues, trending problems
Identifies issues affecting multiple customers
Ticket → Project task with priority, linked to original tickets
Task tracked through dev cycle, time logged
Task marked complete, triggers notification workflow
All customers who reported issue get 'We fixed it!' email
CSAT scores tracked, correlated with fixes released

roi_calculation.scenario: SaaS company, 500 customers, $100/month subscription, 5% monthly churn

perfect_for: Any product business with support tickets
